metadata.title: CVE-2023-2124 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds memory access flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s XFSfile system in how a user restores an XFS image after failure (with a dirtylog journal). This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentiallyescalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2124` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-243-generic - 4.4.0-243.277
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-243-generic - 4.4.0-243.277
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-243-lowlatency - 4.4.0-243.277
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-214.225~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-214.225~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-214.225~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1122-kvm - 4.4.0-1122.132
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1159-aws - 4.4.0-1159.174
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-aws - 4.15.0-1159.172~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-azure - 4.15.0-1168.183~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1153-gcp - 4.15.0-1153.170~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1122-oracle - 4.15.0-1122.133~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-243.277').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-214.225~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1122.132').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1159.174').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1159.172~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1168.183~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1153.170~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1122.133~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
